instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.A1932: What is A1932? A1932 is a model number for a 13 inch size MacBook Air from years Late 2018, 2019 with EMC 3184, that may contain one of these boards depending on the year & configuration: 820-01521..
definitions.820-01521: What is 820-01521? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.PPBUS_G3H: What is PPBUS_G3H? Main system power rail that charges the battery, or is power from the battery, that everything else is powered from. .
definitions.PPDCIN_G3H: What is PPDCIN_G3H? PPDCIN_G3H Is a power rail that comes directly from the laptop charger..
definitions.R7020: What is R7020? Current sense shunt resistor for the charger, the resistors between this and the ISL6259 should be proper rating or else machine will turn off the charger. Measuring pins 27/28 on ISL6259 should give you 20.02 ohms. .
definitions.PP3V3_G3H: What is PP3V3_G3H? PP3V3_G3H is a 3.3v power line that is present when the machine is in a Global System Hardware Off state, and should come on before most other rails so that the USB-C circuitry can be powered for the charger.
definitions.PP3V3_UPC_XB_LDO: What is PP3V3_UPC_XB_LDO? PP3V3_UPC_XB_LDO is an LDO coming out of the CD3215 USB-C muxing/charging chip. This can be shorted to ground by the capacitor on its line, and when this happens, the chip can stop functioning which causes the charger to not turn on..
definitions.PPDCIN_G3H_CHGR: What is PPDCIN_G3H_CHGR? This is the input that comes from the charger..
definitions.PP3V3_UPC_XA_LDO: What is PP3V3_UPC_XA_LDO? PP3V3_UPC_XA_LDO is an LDO coming out of the CD3215 USB-C muxing chip. When this is missing, either a capacitor on the line has shorted, PP3V3_G3H is missing, or the CD3215 is bad..
definitions.PP1V1_UPC_XB_LDO_BMC: What is PP1V1_UPC_XB_LDO_BMC? PP1V1_UPC_XB_LDO is an LDO coming out of the CD3215 USB-C muxing/charging chip. This can be shorted to ground by the capacitor on its line, and when this happens, the chip can stop functioning which causes the charger to not turn on. This can also be missing if the CD3215 chip itself is bad..
definitions.PP1V1_UPC_XA_LDO_BMC: What is PP1V1_UPC_XA_LDO_BMC? PP1V1_UPC_XA_LDO is an LDO coming out of the CD3215 USB-C muxing chip. When this is missing, either a capacitor on the line has shorted, PP3V3_G3H is missing, or the CD3215 is bad..
definitions.PP1V8_UPC_XB_LDOA: What is PP1V8_UPC_XB_LDOA? This is an LDO coming out of the CD3215 USB-C muxing/charging chip. This can be shorted to ground by the capacitor on its line, and when this happens, the chip can stop functioning which causes the charger to not turn on. This can also be missing if the CD3215 chip itself is bad. Each CD3215 in the system needs to be functioning in order for any of them to speak to the charger and negotiate receiving 20v from the charger rather than the default 5v that a USB-C charger puts out before communicating with the system. .
definitions.U7000: What is U7000? U7000 refers to the ISL6258 or ISL6259 charging IC on Macbooks from 2008-2012.
definitions.PPVBAT_G3H_CHGR_R: What is PPVBAT_G3H_CHGR_R? This is a power rail between the battery and a current sense resistor before the battery power feeds current to the rest of the machine. .

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01521</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1932</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> no power got 20v 1.47amp
threads.message:
macbook <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1932</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> with water damage
 20v with 1.47amp stuck from here. 
<SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> is 1.5v with diode to ground 0.468
<SIGNAL>PPDCIN_G3H</SIGNAL> 0v with diode to ground 0.565
theres no short circuit from the big coils. 
what should i check next?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01521</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1932</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> no power got 20v 1.47amp
threads.message:
Did you note liquid sign on the audio board?
Check both sides.
Also look at audio flex and connectors.

Do you get <RESISTOR>R7020</RESISTOR> voltage?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01521</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1932</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> no power got 20v 1.47amp
threads.message:
audio board is corroded too
j6100 connector and audio flex not so bad (looks still ok)
btw i test the board itself without any ribbon connected (removed motherboard from the case)

anyway after i put the board to ultrasonic machine on more time
now the usb meter is 5.19v 1.47amp stuck here.

<SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> 2.1v
<SIGNAL>PPDCIN_G3H</SIGNAL>|<SIGNAL>PPDCIN_G3H_CHGR</SIGNAL> 5.1v
<SIGNAL>PP3V3_G3H</SIGNAL> 0v 0.400 (diode to ground)

<CHIP>U3100</CHIP>
<SIGNAL>PP1V8_UPC_XA_LDOA</SIGNAL>/D 1.8v
<SIGNAL>PP3V3_UPC_XA_LDO</SIGNAL> 3.3v
<SIGNAL>PP1V1_UPC_XA_LDO_BMC</SIGNAL> 0v 0.489

<CHIP>U3200</CHIP>
<SIGNAL>PP1V1_UPC_XB_LDO_BMC</SIGNAL> 0v 0.497
<SIGNAL>PP1V8_UPC_XB_LDOA</SIGNAL>/D 1.8v
<SIGNAL>PP3V3_UPC_XB_LDO</SIGNAL> 3.82v

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01521</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1932</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> no power got 20v 1.47amp
threads.message:
<SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> should appear with just 5V at <RESISTOR>R7020</RESISTOR>.
Post diode mode reading at F7000.

Corrosion on the audio board probably damaged T2.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01521</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1932</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> no power got 20v 1.47amp
<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01521</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1932</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> no power got 20v 1.47amp
threads.message:
Just for note; check diode mode with red probe at ground in the future.

Do you get <RESISTOR>R7020</RESISTOR> voltage?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01521</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1932</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> no power got 20v 1.47amp
threads.message:
<SIGNAL>PPVBAT_G3H_FUSE</SIGNAL> why im having 1.541 ohms? red prove to ground diode mode ofcourse
i replaced already <CHIP>U7000</CHIP>/<TRANSISTOR>Q7065</TRANSISTOR>
<RESISTOR>R7063</RESISTOR> is correct with 1k value
with diode mode red prove to ground  pin1 is 1.541 <SIGNAL>PPVBAT_G3H_FUSE</SIGNAL> |  pin2 0.616  <SIGNAL>CHGR_VBAT</SIGNAL>

<RESISTOR>R7020</RESISTOR> voltage:
<SIGNAL>PPDCIN_G3H</SIGNAL>|CHGR 5.1v

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01521</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1932</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> no power got 20v 1.47amp
<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01521</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1932</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> no power got 20v 1.47amp
threads.message:
<SIGNAL>P_IN</SIGNAL> 5.1v
<SIGNAL>AUX_DET</SIGNAL> 1.2v
VDDA 5.0v
VDDP 4.9v
<SIGNAL>AUX_OK</SIGNAL> no idea how read voltage for this. 
<SIGNAL>EN_MVR</SIGNAL> 0v
AMON 0V
BMON 0V

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01521</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1932</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> no power got 20v 1.47amp
threads.message:
Sorry, <SIGNAL>AUX_OK</SIGNAL> is not used here.

Looks to have <CHIP>U7000</CHIP> issue; try another one.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01521</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1932</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> no power got 20v 1.47amp
threads.message:
ooops, I just realized <CHIP>U7000</CHIP> is not on <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> circuit.
Do not touch <CHIP>U7000</CHIP> yet.
Check <RESISTOR>R7060</RESISTOR> voltage, if exist.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01521</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1932</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> no power got 20v 1.47amp
<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01521</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1932</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> no power got 20v 1.47amp
threads.message:
Strange to get 5V there.
Check <TRANSISTOR>Q7030</TRANSISTOR>/40 for internal short.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01521</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1932</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> no power got 20v 1.47amp
threads.message:
after i removed and clean <TRANSISTOR>Q7030</TRANSISTOR>/40 now got 20v 1.47amp stable on usb meter
<RESISTOR>R7060</RESISTOR> <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> | <SIGNAL>PPVBAT_G3H_CHGR_R</SIGNAL> 12.6v stable
F7000 12.6v looping to 0.2v

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01521</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1932</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> no power got 20v 1.47amp
threads.message:
F7000 is just for battery, as already said.
No reason to check there, unless battery is connected.

Try to put the machine in DFU now.
